_instructions: 1) Add a new unique id to ordered_instruments. This id must exactly match a key under instruments and instrument_meta.
2) Under instruments, add that id with: range, tess, display_name, gm_program, polyphonic.
3) Under instrument_meta, add the same id with: display_name, gm_program, bank.
4) range and tess are MIDI note numbers [low, high]. Keep low <= high.
5) Use realistic playable ranges; the generator enforces pitch behavior against these values.
6) Set polyphonic=true only for instruments that should allow overlapping notes/chords.
7) Keep ordered_instruments in the exact track/render order you want in outputs.
8) gm_program uses General MIDI program numbers (0-based in this project).
9) bank defaults to 0 for standard GM sounds; change only if your synth setup needs it.
10) After edits, run a quick generation (e.g. ONLY=001.txt) to validate no schema/id mismatches.
Common mistake: adding an id to ordered_instruments but forgetting to add the same id in instruments and instrument_meta.
Example id naming: snake_case like alto_flute, bass_clarinet, electric_bass.
Important: this is JSON, so use double quotes and no trailing commas.
